text: so we happen to get all this data out of
that that had to do with pay inequality
but it wasn't only about actresses it
actually also revealed that other
departments there was great wage
disparity editors and sound mixers and
all kinds of different things where
females were paid less than men and I've
talked to many agents managers lawyers
in the business and they all say well we
always know they don't pay girls what
they pay poise well we always know that
they're not going to budget as much for
a female part as a male part
after my speech I went somewhere and a
sound mixer ran up to me and hugged me
so hard and she said oh my god my boss
called me in and gave me a raise the
next day I'd been making so much less
than my male co-workers for so long now
if women take action the company has to
prove that they were not discriminating
against them meaning they have to say to
the woman no we paid you less because
you don't have a diploma or you sell
less of this product or you've worked
for us for a shorter time they have to
show a tangible reason why they can pay
this woman less than her white male
counterpart in the same job so that's a
drastic difference what's exciting about
is already companies are contacting
lawyers because it goes into effect in
January and they're saying we didn't
mean to have discriminatory practices
but we do realize now that we were
paying this female manager 20,000
dollars less than this male manager at
this other location
